column7: \"title\": \"What happens on Brexit day and what comes next?\"
column8: \"content\": \"There will be little official pageantry to mark Britain\\u2019s departure from the European Union at 11pm on Friday. A clock counting down the last hour will be projected on to No 10 Downing Street
column9: and Nigel Farage will host a celebration in Parliament Square where flagpoles will fly union jacks.\\n\\nBut there will be nothing like the torchlight procession that marked the august occasion on 1 January 1973 when the prime minister Edward Heath was joined in Brussels by his predecessors Harold Macmillan
column10: Alec Douglas-Home and a chorus of leaders from across the political divide to witness the accession of the UK into the European Economic Community.\\n\\nFriday will mark the start of what is likely to be an uphill battle to get a trade deal done by the end of the year
column11: not to mention all the non-trade issues that must also be resolved including security and intelligence cooperation
column12: fisheries
column13: data
column14: education and research collaboration.\\n\\nYes. Although everyday life will remain the same and the UK will remain in the single market and the customs union until the end of the year as part of transition arrangements
column15: the withdrawal agreement will be a legally binding international treaty. It carries sanctions for any \\u201cbacksliding or half measures\\u201d
column16: as Michel Barnier\\u2019s adviser Stefaan de Rynck pointed out last week in London.\\n\\nWhat happens next?\\n\\nWe know little of the plans for the negotiations
column17: and parliamentary scrutiny of Brexit has been restricted. The House of Lords EU committee has invited but failed to get Stephen Barclay to appear to explain the next stages
column18: sources say.\\n\\n\\u201cThe UK is five days away from entering into a highly complex and potentially extensive set of negotiations with the EU
column19: and from entering into quite an elaborate joint institutional architecture with the EU to manage the withdrawal agreement. But we know little in detail about how either of these are going to work on the UK side
column20: in terms of institutions and process
column21: \\u201d says Brigid Fowler
column22: a senior researcher with the Hansard Society.\\n\\nWhile business has been clamouring for the government to reveal its Brexit vision beyond the joint aspiration of a tariff-free
column24: little is known about Boris Johnson\\u2019s specific goals.\\n\\nHow will the PM lead the next phase?\\n\\nJohnson is doing everything he can to expunge the word Brexit from the British lexicon. He has already reduced parliamentary scrutiny of the next phase
column25: and his government has given only clues as to what the goals and red lines in negotiations will be.\\n\\nNegotiating mandates setting out wishlists and red lines are usually published by both sides before they enter into trade talks. Until Sunday
column26: when the Brexit secretary
column27: Stephen Barclay
column28: told the BBC\\u2019s Andrew Marr that they would be published
column29: it had not been clear that Johnson would do so at all.\\n\\nThe prime minister is expected to give further clues in a keynote speech in the next fortnight
column30: but parliament\\u2019s involvement in approving the negotiating mandate was removed from the Brexit bill.\\n\\n\\u201cEssentially
column31: the government seems to be planning to rely on normal mechanisms for ministerial accountability to parliament. These put the government in control of what information is made public and when
column32: \\u201d says Fowler.\\n\\nWhat about the cabinet reshuffle and Dominic Cummings\\u2019 mooted Whitehall bloodbath?\\n\\nA reshuffle is expected in early February and some departments are expected to be axed. Barclay\\u2019s Brexit department will close on Friday and there could be changes to the function of the Treasury
column33: the Department for International Trade
column34: the Foreign Office
column35: the Department for Business
column37: the Home Office and the Department for Environment
column38: Food and Rural Affairs.\\n\\nMichael Gove
column39: the chancellor of the duchy of Lancaster
column40: continues to head a special Exiting the EU operation committee
column41: known as XO
column42: and is expected to continue to have a key role in the next phase.\\n\\nHMRC will be one of the key cogs in the Brexit chain as work must start urgently on the complex arrangements for Northern Ireland that will affect all businesses trading on both sides of the Irish Sea. Expect an early clash between the EU and Johnson
column43: who has repeatedly claimed there will be no checks on goods
column44: in contradiction of the withdrawal agreement.\\n\\nNew border systems will be needed for the rest of the UK
column45: and the EU and HMRC will be frustrated in designing them until the shape of the deal is known
column46: possibly not until the summer. HMRC is short of key personnel and recently advertised for a deputy director to take charge of EU exit
column47: who \\u201cwill be responsible for providing the strategic direction for the project
column48: delivering all the operational
column49: communications and business changes needed in readiness for the UK\\u2019s exit.\\u201d\\n\\nA former head of HMRC has said it could take five years to get the sort of IT system proposed for Northern Ireland up and running.\\n\\nExpect plenty of sabre-rattling on both sides
column50: but negotiations are unlikely to begin before March. The European commission kicked off its 30-stage process in agreeing its negotiating goals before Christmas and these are expected to be signed off by member states at a meeting on 25 February.\\n\\nWho will be negotiating for the UK?\\n\\nDavid Frost
column51: who replaced Oliver Robbins as the chief negotiator
column52: is expected to lead a team of about 30 calling on expert knowledge from civil servants and trade experts. Some have suggested the government should hire as many as possible from the Canadian team that sealed Canada\\u2019s new deal with the EU.\\n\\nWhat about the joint committee?\\n\\nUnder the withdrawal agreement
column53: a joint committee of EU and UK representatives to oversee implementation of the treaty can sit from 1 February.\\n\\nWhile the powers of the committee are known
column54: we know very little else. The appointments process
column55: the size of the committee and how often it will meet has yet to be disclosed. One senior source said the committee would not be as influential as speculated.\\n\\nThis remains the single most contentious part of the Brexit deal because of the checks on goods crossing the Irish Sea. De Rynck said last week that the EU and the UK would have to be \\u201cvery disciplined\\u201d if they were to get a new system for trading in Northern Ireland ready for 31 December.\\n\\nBrussels and Irish political leaders are already alarmed by Johnson\\u2019s repeated declarations that there will be no checks on goods crossing the Irish Sea
column56: even though some of these will be mandatory.\\n\\nHelen McEntee
column57: Ireland\\u2019s minister for European affairs contradicted him directly on Sunday telling Sky News\\u2019s Sophy Ridge: \\u201cThere will be no checks on the island of Ireland
column58: we\\u2019ve been very clear on this.\\u201d\\n\\nUnderneath the joint committee will be a specialised committee and working advisory group to establish the Northern Ireland protocol.\\n\\nNorthern Ireland businesses have urged the government to set up the working group urgently so that the detail of the checks can be determined quickly.\"

column9: and Nigel Farage will host a celebration in Parliament Square where flagpoles will fly union jacks.\\n\\nBut there will be nothing like the torchlight procession that marked the august occasion on 1 January 1973 when the prime minister Edward Heath was joined in Brussels by his predecessors Harold Macmillan
column10: Alec Douglas-Home and a chorus of leaders from across the political divide to witness the accession of the UK into the European Economic Community.\\n\\nFriday will mark the start of what is likely to be an uphill battle to get a trade deal done by the end of the year

text: we will weep forever nba mourns death of basketball great kobe bryant the nba grappled with the sudden death of league great kobe bryant on sunday players saying they felt sick to their stomach taking to the court without having ample time to absorb the shocking news
source: {\id\": \"france24--2020-01-27--\\u2018We will weep forever\\u2019: NBA mourns death of basketball great Kobe Bryant\"
column7: \"title\": \"\\u2018We will weep forever\\u2019: NBA mourns death of basketball great Kobe Bryant\"
column8: \"content\": \"The NBA grappled with the sudden death of league great Kobe Bryant on Sunday
column9: players saying they felt sick to their stomach taking to the court without having ample time to absorb the shocking news.\\n\\nA haunting moment of silence preceded the Houston Rockets' game against the Nuggets in Denver
column10: which tipped off just hours after the helicopter crash in suburban Los Angeles in which Bryant and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna were among nine who perished.\\n\\n\\n\\nIn San Antonio
column11: where the Spurs hosted the reigning champion Toronto Raptors
column12: both teams took 24-second shot-clock violations on their first possessions of the game in honor of Bryant \\u2013 who wore the number 24 in the later years of his career.\\n\\n\\n\\nAnd in a move that other NBA teams are also expected to adopt
column13: the Dallas Mavericks announced that they were retiring the number 24 jersey.\\n\\n\\n\\nSeveral NBA stars said they were reluctant to step on the court after learning the news.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cI don't even know how we are supposed to play this game tonight
column14: \\\" said Portland's Damian Lillard said before scoring 50 points in a 139-129 win over Indiana. \\\"It makes you sick to your stomach. It is disturbing.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt is bigger than just our heroes and the people we look up to dying. It goes deeper than that.\\\"\\n\\n\\n\\nNewly-retired Miami Heat star Dwayne Wade described Sunday as \\\"one of the saddest days of my lifetime
column15: \\\" adding that he couldn't believe Bryant was gone and that his family had been sharing Kobe stories all day.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt seems like a bad dream that you just want to wake up from. It is a nightmare
column16: \\\" he said.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt is not going to go away soon. We will weep forever.\\\"\\n\\nEight NBA games were on tap Sunday
column17: and the prevailing mood in every arena was sadness and shock.Lillard said their coach Terry Stotts told them to go out and honor Bryant by not holding back.\\u201cCoach said Kobe is the toughest to ever play this game. He said we should honor him that way.\\u201cIt was on all of our minds. In the time outs... it hurt all of us in our hearts. I look up to him. He's our hero. It is sad man
column18: real sad day.\\\"Reigning NBA finals MVP Kawhi Leonard said all of Los Angeles was feeling the loss.\\u201cNo words can explain the impact he had on the floor
column19: \\\" said Los Angeles Clippers Leonard. \\u201cWe are a team from Los Angeles so we know the LA history with him. It is just sad.\\\"New Orleans Pelicans rookie Zion Williamson was preparing to start just his third career NBA contest against Boston when he was floored by news of the death.\\u201cI couldn't focus at first when I heard the news
column20: \\\" said Williamson
column21: who was born the year Bryant won his first NBA championship in 2000. \\u201cIt was tough getting out there. I just hate to see it happen like that to him and his daughter.\\\"Clippers coach Doc Rivers fought back tears as he spoke to reporters before his team took on the Magic in Orlando.\\u201cWe're all Lakers right now
column22: \\\" Rivers said
column23: calling himself \\u201clucky\\\" to have had a chance to coach against Bryant \\u2013 who won five NBA titles with the Los Angeles Lakers.\\u201cHe was such a great opponent
column24: \\\" Rivers said. \\u201cIt's what you want in sports. He had that DNA that very few athletes can ever have \\u2013 the Tiger Woodses and Michael Jordans.\\n\\n\\n\\n'Crazy day to play basketball' \\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cLooking at my young players and seeing how devastated they are
column25: \\\" Rivers said as he lost his battle to hold back his tears.\\n\\n\\n\\nNew Orleans coach Alvin Gentry said Bryant was one of the most driven players he has ever seen.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cI don't know where you could even start
column26: \\\" said Gentry before his team's game against Boston.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cGreat competitor
column27: great guy
column28: great father. Just really a sad
column29: sad day for the NBA.\\n\\n\\n\\nAtlanta Hawks rising star Trae Young said he was just getting to know Bryant and his basketball playing daughter.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cThis is a crazy day to play basketball
column30: \\\" Young said before the Hawks beat Washington 152-133. \\\"I talked to him couple of times.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cHe's only been to three games this year and two of them were ours. His daughter was a big fan of mine.\\\"\\n\\n\\n\\nBryant was one of the best closers the NBA has ever seen. Throughout his career
column31: Bryant would baffle his coach Phil Jackson with his penchant to start games slowly before assuming total command in the fourth quarter. \\n\\n\\n\\nFormer German all-star Dirk Nowitzki referred to Bryant's finishing skills in a heart-tugging written tribute.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cI remember coming home after games so I could watch you dominate in the fourth quarter! You will always be loved. Rest in Peace with your angel Gigi

column30: \\\" Young said before the Hawks beat Washington 152-133. \\\"I talked to him couple of times.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cHe's only been to three games this year and two of them were ours. His daughter was a big fan of mine.\\\"\\n\\n\\n\\nBryant was one of the best closers the NBA has ever seen. Throughout his career
column31: Bryant would baffle his coach Phil Jackson with his penchant to start games slowly before assuming total command in the fourth quarter. \\n\\n\\n\\nFormer German all-star Dirk Nowitzki referred to Bryant's finishing skills in a heart-tugging written tribute.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cI remember coming home after games so I could watch you dominate in the fourth quarter! You will always be loved. Rest in Peace with your angel Gigi

column7: \"title\": \"\\u2018We will weep forever\\u2019: NBA mourns death of basketball great Kobe Bryant\"
column8: \"content\": \"The NBA grappled with the sudden death of league great Kobe Bryant on Sunday
column9: players saying they felt sick to their stomach taking to the court without having ample time to absorb the shocking news.\\n\\nA haunting moment of silence preceded the Houston Rockets' game against the Nuggets in Denver
column10: which tipped off just hours after the helicopter crash in suburban Los Angeles in which Bryant and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna were among nine who perished.\\n\\n\\n\\nIn San Antonio
column11: where the Spurs hosted the reigning champion Toronto Raptors
column12: both teams took 24-second shot-clock violations on their first possessions of the game in honor of Bryant \\u2013 who wore the number 24 in the later years of his career.\\n\\n\\n\\nAnd in a move that other NBA teams are also expected to adopt
column13: the Dallas Mavericks announced that they were retiring the number 24 jersey.\\n\\n\\n\\nSeveral NBA stars said they were reluctant to step on the court after learning the news.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cI don't even know how we are supposed to play this game tonight
column14: \\\" said Portland's Damian Lillard said before scoring 50 points in a 139-129 win over Indiana. \\\"It makes you sick to your stomach. It is disturbing.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt is bigger than just our heroes and the people we look up to dying. It goes deeper than that.\\\"\\n\\n\\n\\nNewly-retired Miami Heat star Dwayne Wade described Sunday as \\\"one of the saddest days of my lifetime
column15: \\\" adding that he couldn't believe Bryant was gone and that his family had been sharing Kobe stories all day.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt seems like a bad dream that you just want to wake up from. It is a nightmare
column16: \\\" he said.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt is not going to go away soon. We will weep forever.\\\"\\n\\nEight NBA games were on tap Sunday
column17: and the prevailing mood in every arena was sadness and shock.Lillard said their coach Terry Stotts told them to go out and honor Bryant by not holding back.\\u201cCoach said Kobe is the toughest to ever play this game. He said we should honor him that way.\\u201cIt was on all of our minds. In the time outs... it hurt all of us in our hearts. I look up to him. He's our hero. It is sad man
column18: real sad day.\\\"Reigning NBA finals MVP Kawhi Leonard said all of Los Angeles was feeling the loss.\\u201cNo words can explain the impact he had on the floor
column19: \\\" said Los Angeles Clippers Leonard. \\u201cWe are a team from Los Angeles so we know the LA history with him. It is just sad.\\\"New Orleans Pelicans rookie Zion Williamson was preparing to start just his third career NBA contest against Boston when he was floored by news of the death.\\u201cI couldn't focus at first when I heard the news
column20: \\\" said Williamson
column21: who was born the year Bryant won his first NBA championship in 2000. \\u201cIt was tough getting out there. I just hate to see it happen like that to him and his daughter.\\\"Clippers coach Doc Rivers fought back tears as he spoke to reporters before his team took on the Magic in Orlando.\\u201cWe're all Lakers right now
column22: \\\" Rivers said
column23: calling himself \\u201clucky\\\" to have had a chance to coach against Bryant \\u2013 who won five NBA titles with the Los Angeles Lakers.\\u201cHe was such a great opponent
column24: \\\" Rivers said. \\u201cIt's what you want in sports. He had that DNA that very few athletes can ever have \\u2013 the Tiger Woodses and Michael Jordans.\\n\\n\\n\\n'Crazy day to play basketball' \\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cLooking at my young players and seeing how devastated they are
column25: \\\" Rivers said as he lost his battle to hold back his tears.\\n\\n\\n\\nNew Orleans coach Alvin Gentry said Bryant was one of the most driven players he has ever seen.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cI don't know where you could even start
column26: \\\" said Gentry before his team's game against Boston.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cGreat competitor

column9: players saying they felt sick to their stomach taking to the court without having ample time to absorb the shocking news.\\n\\nA haunting moment of silence preceded the Houston Rockets' game against the Nuggets in Denver

column11: where the Spurs hosted the reigning champion Toronto Raptors
column12: both teams took 24-second shot-clock violations on their first possessions of the game in honor of Bryant \\u2013 who wore the number 24 in the later years of his career.\\n\\n\\n\\nAnd in a move that other NBA teams are also expected to adopt
column13: the Dallas Mavericks announced that they were retiring the number 24 jersey.\\n\\n\\n\\nSeveral NBA stars said they were reluctant to step on the court after learning the news.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cI don't even know how we are supposed to play this game tonight
column14: \\\" said Portland's Damian Lillard said before scoring 50 points in a 139-129 win over Indiana. \\\"It makes you sick to your stomach. column15: \\\" adding that he couldn't believe Bryant was gone and that his family had been sharing Kobe stories all day.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt seems like a bad dream that you just want to wake up from. It is a nightmare
column16: \\\" he said.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\u201cIt is not going to go away soon. We will weep forever.\\\"\\n\\nEight NBA games were on tap Sunday
